result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and filed: Justice Point Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report.

Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in court.  
Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers.  
Attorney Willam Ackell for Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.Defense counsel request  final pretrial and Jury trial dates.
Court ordered parties to file substantive final pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the hearing.
Case remans calendared in Branch 19 and ordered matter adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 07-21-2022

Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are close to reaching resolution in this matter and are requesting a date for plea and sentencing.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case scheduled for bail bond hearing. Defense no longer wishes to address bail. Defense has received discovery. Parties working on potential resolution. Court addressed good JusticePoint report and commends the defendant on his hard work. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM021256  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/22/2022

Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for bail review in Branch 45. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAG and Latara D.

Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kazi Samuel Wynn-Beavers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
